R2.nl_constraint: A person should never be debarked in a same city more than once

<documents>
<pddl_domain>
;; Enrico Scala (enricos83@gmail.com) and Miquel Ramirez (miquel.ramirez@gmail.com)
(define (domain zenotravel)
        ;(:requirements :typing :fluents)
        (:types
                locatable city - object
                aircraft person - locatable
        )
        (:predicates
                (located ?x - locatable ?c - city)
                (in ?p - person ?a - aircraft)
        )
        (:functions
                (fuel ?a - aircraft)
                (distance ?c1 - city ?c2 - city)
                (slow_burn ?a - aircraft)
                (fast_burn ?a - aircraft)
                (capacity ?a - aircraft)
                (total_fuel_used)
                (onboard ?a - aircraft)
                (zoom_limit ?a - aircraft)

                (n_board ?p - person ?a - aircraft ?c - city)
                (n_debark ?p - person ?a - aircraft ?c - city)
                (n_flyslow ?a - aircraft ?c1 ?c2 - city)
                (n_flyfast ?a - aircraft ?c1 ?c2 - city)
                (n_refuel ?a - aircraft)
        )

        (:action board
                :parameters (?p - person ?a - aircraft ?c - city)
                :precondition (and (located ?p ?c)
                        (located ?a ?c))
                :effect (and (not (located ?p ?c))
                        (in ?p ?a)
                        (increase (onboard ?a) 1)
                        (increase (n_board ?p ?a ?c) 1))
        )

        (:action debark
                :parameters (?p - person ?a - aircraft ?c - city)
                :precondition (and (in ?p ?a)
                        (located ?a ?c))
                :effect (and (not (in ?p ?a))
                        (located ?p ?c)
                        (decrease (onboard ?a) 1)
                        (increase (n_debark ?p ?a ?c) 1))
        )

        (:action flyslow
                :parameters (?a - aircraft ?c1 ?c2 - city)
                :precondition (and (located ?a ?c1)
                        (>= (fuel ?a)
                                (* (distance ?c1 ?c2) (slow_burn ?a))))
                :effect (and (not (located ?a ?c1))
                        (located ?a ?c2)
                        (increase
                                (total_fuel_used)
                                (* (distance ?c1 ?c2) (slow_burn ?a)))
                        (decrease
                                (fuel ?a)
                                (* (distance ?c1 ?c2) (slow_burn ?a)))
                        (increase (n_flyslow ?a ?c1 ?c2) 1))
        )

        (:action flyfast
                :parameters (?a - aircraft ?c1 ?c2 - city)
                :precondition (and (located ?a ?c1)
                        (>= (fuel ?a)
                                (* (distance ?c1 ?c2) (fast_burn ?a)))
                        (<= (onboard ?a) (zoom_limit ?a)))
                :effect (and (not (located ?a ?c1))
                        (located ?a ?c2)
                        (increase
                                (total_fuel_used)
                                (* (distance ?c1 ?c2) (fast_burn ?a)))
                        (decrease
                                (fuel ?a)
                                (* (distance ?c1 ?c2) (fast_burn ?a)))
                        (increase (n_flyfast ?a ?c1 ?c2) 1))
        )

        (:action refuel
                :parameters (?a - aircraft)
                :precondition (and (> (capacity ?a) (fuel ?a))

                )
                :effect (and (assign (fuel ?a) (capacity ?a))
                        (increase (n_refuel ?a) 1))
        )

)
</pddl_domain>
<pddl_problem>
(define (problem ZTRAVEL-3-10)
(:domain zenotravel)
(:objects
	plane1 - aircraft
	plane2 - aircraft
	plane3 - aircraft
	person1 - person
	person2 - person
	person3 - person
	person4 - person
	person5 - person
	person6 - person

	person9 - person
	person10 - person

	city1 - city
	city2 - city
	city3 - city
	city4 - city
	city5 - city
	)
(:init

	(= (capacity plane1) 2326)
	(= (fuel plane1) 205)
	(= (slow_burn plane1) 1)
	(= (fast_burn plane1) 2)

	(located person1 city1)

	(located person7 city0)

	(= (distance city0 city0) 0)

	(= (distance city1 city0) 619)
	(= (distance city1 city1) 0)
	(= (distance city1 city2) 561)

	(= (distance city1 city4) 760)
	(= (distance city1 city5) 980)
	(= (distance city2 city0) 565)
	(= (distance city2 city1) 561)
	(= (distance city2 city2) 0)
	(= (distance city2 city3) 657)
	(= (distance city2 city4) 702)
	(= (distance city2 city5) 639)
	(= (distance city3 city0) 886)
	(= (distance city3 city1) 756)
	(= (distance city3 city2) 657)
	(= (distance city3 city3) 0)
	(= (distance city3 city4) 546)
	(= (distance city3 city5) 510)
	(= (distance city4 city0) 596)
	(= (distance city4 city1) 760)
	(= (distance city4 city2) 702)
	(= (distance city4 city3) 546)
	(= (distance city4 city4) 0)
	(= (distance city4 city5) 850)
	(= (distance city5 city0) 766)
	(= (distance city5 city1) 980)
	(= (distance city5 city2) 639)
	(= (distance city5 city3) 510)
	(= (distance city5 city4) 850)
	(= (distance city5 city5) 0)
	(= (total_fuel_used) 0)
)
(:goal (and
	(located plane1 city4)
	(located person1 city4)
	(located person2 city5)
	(located person3 city4)
	(located person4 city0)
	(located person5 city2)
	(located person6 city3)
	(located person8 city0)
	(located person9 city3)
	(located person10 city4)
	))

(:metric minimize (total_fuel_used))





)

<information>
The user will give as input a natural language constraint that must be translated into PDDL3.0. The translation will be used by a PDDL planner.
</information>

<instructions> 
- Translate the input constraint into correct PDDL3.0.
- The resulting PDDL3.0 constraint must capture the same meaning as the initial input constraint.
- Remember that PDDL3.0 constraints are state-based. They can only refer to existing precates and fluents, thus, not to actions.
- Be sure to include temporal logic like operators in your translation.
- Format your answer such as there is no preambule and such that the PDDL translation is between the tags <pddl> and </pddl>.
</instructions>

<user_input>
A person should never be debarked in a same city more than once
</user_input>

Let me analyze the user's constraint: "A person should never be debarked in a same city more than once"

First, I need to understand what this means in the context of the zenotravel domain:
- A person can be debarked multiple times during the planning process
- But a person should never be debarked more than once in the same city
- This means if person1 is debarked in city1, then person1 should not be debarked in city1 again

Looking at the domain, I can see there's a function `(n_debark ?p - person ?a - aircraft ?c - city)` that tracks the number of times a person has been debarked from an aircraft in a city.

In PDDL3.0, I need to express this as a state-based constraint. The constraint should say that for any person and any city, the number of times that person has been debarked in that city should be at most 1.

Since this is a temporal constraint that must always hold, I should use the `always` operator from PDDL3.0.

The constraint would be:
- For all persons p and all cities c, n_debark(p, a, c) <= 1

But wait, n_debark takes three parameters: person, aircraft, and city. The constraint is about a person being debarked in a city, regardless of which aircraft. So I need to think about this more carefully.

Actually, looking at the function definition again:
`(n_debark ?p - person ?a - aircraft ?c - city)`

This tracks the number of times person p has been debarked from aircraft a in city c. But the constraint is about a person never being debarked in the same city more than once, regardless of aircraft.

So I need to express that for any person p and city c, the sum of n_debark(p, a, c) over all aircraft a should be at most 1.


I'll craft a PDDL3.0 constraint that captures this requirement, ensuring a person can't be debarked multiple times in the same city across different aircraft. The challenge is creating a generalized constraint that works for any number of aircraft.

The constraint needs to sum the debark count across all possible aircraft, limiting it to 1 for each person-city combination. This prevents multiple debarkations in the same city, regardless of the specific aircraft used.

The tracking function n_debark precisely records these debarkation events, allowing us to enforce this rule systematically. By limiting the total debarkations to 1, we prevent redundant or unnecessary city stops for each individual.

The constraint uses a universal quantification across all planes and cities, ensuring no person can exit multiple aircraft in the same location. This elegant logical formulation guarantees unique city debarking for each traveler.
